SEARCH
Package lab5

Class Loan

java.lang.Object
lab5.Loan
public class Loan extends Object
The Loan class represents a loan with an annual interest rate, number of years, loan amount, and loan date. It provides methods to calculate monthly and total payments.
Version:
1.0
Author:
DR. SUKHWANT KAUR SAGAR

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Loan()
    Default constructor that creates a Loan object with default values: annualInterestRate = 2.5%, numberOfYears = 1, loanAmount = $1000

    Parameterized constructor that creates a Loan object with specified values.

      annualInterestRate - the annual interest rate of the loan
      numberOfYears - the number of years for the loan
      loanAmount - the loan amount

      public void setLoanAmount(double loanAmount)
      Sets a new amount for this loan.
      Parameters:
      loanAmount - the new loan amount

    • getMonthlyPayment

      public double getMonthlyPayment()
      Calculates and returns the monthly payment for this loan. Formula: monthlyPayment = (loanAmount * monthlyInterestRate) / (1 - (1 / (1 + monthlyInterestRate)^numberOfMonths)) Special case: If interest rate is 0%, returns loanAmount / numberOfMonths
      Returns:
      the monthly payment rounded to 2 decimal places

    • getTotalPayment

      public double getTotalPayment()
      Calculates and returns the total payment for this loan. Formula: totalPayment = monthlyPayment * numberOfYears * 12
      Returns:
      the total payment rounded to 2 decimal places

    • getTotalInterest

      public double getTotalInterest()
      Calculates and returns the total interest paid over the life of the loan. Formula: totalInterest = getTotalPayment() - loanAmount
      Returns:
      the total interest rounded to 2 decimal places

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this loan. Format: Loan[amount=$X.XX, rate=X.X%, years=X, monthly=$X.XX]
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing this loan

    • getRemainingBalance

      public double getRemainingBalance(int monthsPaid)
      Calculates the remaining balance on the loan after a specified number of months. Uses the amortization formula to determine how much principal is left to pay.
      Parameters:
      monthsPaid - the number of months already paid
      Returns:
      the remaining balance rounded to 2 decimal places, or 0 if loan is paid off

    • isAffordable

      public boolean isAffordable(double monthlyIncome)
      Determines if this loan is affordable based on the borrower's monthly income. Uses the 28% rule: monthly payment should not exceed 28% of monthly income.
      Parameters:
      monthlyIncome - the borrower's monthly income
      Returns:
      true if the loan is affordable, false otherwise

    • getPayoffDate

      public Date getPayoffDate()
      Calculates and returns the date when this loan will be paid off. Adds the number of months (years * 12) to the loan creation date.
      Returns:
      the payoff date
